Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2017 09:49PM Bmac16 wrote: MamaOz and Legomaster225 I finished rads on Sept 19. Breast was totally fried and I was concerned about the scar under my arm from lymph node removal. RO told me to keep using the lotions/cream for 2 weeks and all would be good. She was right, 2 weeks to the day, everything looks great.

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2017 08:41PM Bmac16 wrote: LoriBee I think we started on the same day. I had session number 6 today. I got through 24 weeks of chemo with minor SE. I'm also dreading how bad this may be as I'm very light skinned. I hadn't heard large breasted women get a larger dose. Not good news for me. I have been using an aloe product twice a day and so far so good.
Posts.Title: Starting Radiation August 2017 Legomaster225 2017sanam

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2017 12:39AM Bmac16 wrote: I finished 30 sessions on Tuesday. I am very tired now. As predicted by my RO my skin is very pink. The only place it is sore is under my arm around the area my lymph nodes were removed back in December. So far no blisters but the RO recommended neosporin as well as the aloe gel just in case. She said although radiation is over, my skin will get worse before it gets better. I'm so happy to be done with 24 weeks of chemo and 6 weeks of radiation, to all of you still going through this, you can do it!!
Posts.Title: Starting Radiation August 2017 Legomaster225 2017sanam

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2017 03:04PM Bmac16 wrote: CTJ1108 I also have session number 10 today, but only a third of the way through. I started back at work part time last week. On Friday evening I also "hit the wall". Thought it may be all the driving back and forth to work and then back and forth to radiation. Glad for the weekend break. I will see what this week brings.
